description:
The crash occurred in the eastbound lane of a two-lane roadway with an intersection controlled
                        by a traffic control. Conditions were cloudy and dry in the afternoon on a weekday. The posted
                        speed limit was 72 kmph (45 mph).


                        V1 was a 2005 Hyundai Santa Fe SUV traveling in the first travel lane approaching the
                        intersection controlled by a traffic signal intending on going straight. V2, a 2000 Sterling
                        A9500 M/H truck, was stopped at the intersection with a red traffic control signal. The front of
                        V1 struck the back of V2 in the eastbound lane. Both vehicles came to final rest facing
                        eastbound.


                        V1 was driven by a 69-year-old male who sustained moderate injuries and was transported to a
                        local hospital. The driver of V1 refused to be interviewed. V1 was towed due to damage.


                        The Critical Precrash Event for V1 was other motor vehicle in lane; other vehicle stopped. The
                        Critical Reason for the Critical Precrash Event was coded as an unknown driver error due to the
                        lack of interview.


                        V2 was driven by a 44-year-old male who was not injured. He stated that he was decelerating
                        because of the red traffic control signal. V2 then made a complete stop and soon after he felt a
                        push and a loud noise. V2 did not take any avoidance actions. V2 was driven away from the scene.


                        The Critical Precrash Event for V2 was other motor vehicle in lane; traveling in same direction
                        with higher speed. No Critical Reason for the critical precrash event was coded to this vehicle.
